page.title: 09Transport.
page.content: The first transport system that came to the area was the canal,which is now disused .It used to run near Upton Magna,through Berwick Wharf and then Uffington.By the canal in Uffington there are some cottages called canal cottages they are called canal cottages because the canal used to run past them.There is still evidence of the canal.The evidence is the old canal bridge which is by Upton Forge. The other evidence is where the water used to run.Then we had the Railway which was used for quick communication,but now the station at Upton Magna has been closed down.We have the narrow lanes and roads which are used for cars and occasionly a bus .But now they are planning to build a motorway that might go through the area.This will be the third major transport system to effect the area.
